Pre-Game Insights: India come into the game on the back of a disappointing loss to South Africa, but they have looked good as a unit with the duo of Virat Kohli and Suryakumar Yadav standing out with the bat.
Bangladesh have managed to eke out wins against Zimbabwe and the Netherlands but will be keen to beat their neighbors.
Although India will start as the favorites, they will be wary of what Bangladesh are capable of doing.
A relatively high-scoring game is expected at the Adelaide Oval with the average score being 161.
With this being the second game of the day, the pitch could be a touch on the slower side.
The team batting first have won three out of five matches at the venue, but dew could play a role in the second innings.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Dinesh Karthik's fitness is a concern ahead of the clash.

Bangladesh probable playing 11: Najmul Hossain Shanto, Soumya Sarkar, Litton Das, Shakib al Hasan (c), Afif Hossain, Yasir Ali, Mosaddek Hossain Saikat, Nurul Hasan (wk), Taskin Ahmed, Hasan Mahmud and Mustafizur Rahman.

India probable playing 11: KL Rahul, Rohit Sharma (c), Virat Kohli, Suryakumar Yadav, Hardik Pandya, Dinesh Karthik/Rishabh Pant (wk), Axar Patel, Harshal Patel/Ravichandran Ashwin, Bhuvneshwar Kumar, Arshdeep Singh and Mohammed Shami.
